name: nytimes
text: In his victory speech, President-elect Joe Biden said of Black voters: “You’ve always had my back, and I’ll have yours.” Many of those voters are watching to see whether he defers to bipartisanship and civility, or fulfills vows to combat systemic racism. https://t.co/6V3p7Vet4I

name: nytimes
text: With two videography teams and portable air monitors, we measured the pollution that Monu, 13, and Aamya, 11, were exposed to moment-by-moment, showing them in parallel as they went about a normal day. https://t.co/lrGj7JXKVQ https://t.co/fHEjr2a4Ya

name: nytimes
text: From the start of their day, Dec. 3 of last year, the contrasts in exposure were striking. Aamya was driven to school in an air conditioned car. Monu, from a less wealthy family, rode his bike through the smog. https://t.co/lrGj7JXKVQ https://t.co/WWROHdlMx5

name: nytimes
text: The children’s schools offered more contrast: Monu’s was outdoors under a busy and polluted highway; Aamya’s was indoors at a school with air filters. https://t.co/lrGj7JXKVQ https://t.co/TtIZa5Q5Jz

name: nytimes
text: At home, Monu’s mother cooked meals outdoors over an open flame. Aamya’s family employed a cook. All the while, we measured the pollution in the air to document differences in the kids’ exposure. https://t.co/lrGj7JXKVQ https://t.co/ezGI1YY6LA

name: nytimes
text:
The results were telling: Monu was exposed to about four times as much pollution as Aamya on the day we were with them, a disparity that could have dire consequences for his health if it continued throughout his life.
https://t.co/lrGj7JXKVQ

name: nytimes
text: Health departments across the U.S. have said they will not publish coronavirus case numbers over the Christmas holiday. The seven-day average for new cases will be distorted by holiday reporting patterns until at least Jan. 8. https://t.co/xfYs7KSOKM

text: Columbus officials moved to fire the officer who fatally shot a Black man within seconds of encountering him on Tuesday. The police chief said the officer “must be terminated” for not turning on a body camera and not providing aid to the man he shot. https://t.co/SKT3zBIjK0

name: nytimes
text: Update: Nashville authorities said they believe the explosion was an “intentional” act. Officials said at a news conference that three people were injured and taken to hospitals. https://t.co/ucYy3yz8xV
